result.execSummary:
The defendant John Kevin Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived, due to low income.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence at the Day Reporting Center, if accepted. Defendant can have ES. If not accepted at Day Reporting Center, sentence to be served at the HOC; STRAIGHT TIME

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Kevin Walton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Kevin Walton in court, in custody  with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery with student,  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  SEVEN  MONTHS  at the Day Reporting Center if accepted, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. Defendant can have ES. If not accepted at Day Reporting Center, sentence to be served at the House of Correction Straight time. 

Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived , due to low income. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant John Kevin Walton not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: RICHARD L; MIDHAT F; 27TH STREET TOBACCO AND WIRELESS STORE -848 N 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Kevin Walton in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant John Kevin Walton in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
